examples: You're not calling the shots anymore.
Creating new music isn't exactly on his front burner anymore.
John's elderly mother rarely left the house anymore, but when his car broke down and he needed a ride, suddenly she was up and out the door.
I layed down the law and now my wife doesn't cheat on me anymore.
I don't want to be just a cog in the machine anymore!
words.defineEn: no longer
words.defineVi: không còn

examples: That ship of yours clearly has had her day.
The photographs clearly show a broken window.
That resolution clearly withered on the vine.
She was clearly speaking the truth.
The witness was clearly lying through his teeth.
words.defineEn: with no doubt
words.defineVi: không có nghi ngờ

examples: 30 years ago, employers essentially held workers’ hands through their financial lives.
Deprivation was essentially trumping any inborn intelligence.
Essentially, this technique carves a patient’s contact lens prescription onto their cornea.
The parasite is essentially mimicking a clutch of eggs.
The river delta of the Ganges essentially makes up the entire country.
words.defineEn: used to emphasize the fundamental nature or characteristics of someone or something
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nhấn mạnh bản chất cơ bản hoặc đặc điểm của một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: You're the kind of person who walks and chews gum at the same time, so I guess this task load won't be a problem for you.
At the same time, Maduro's opposition was swiftly gaining strength.
At the same time, companies announced buybacks to the tune of a record $1.1 trillion worth of their own stock.
Deodorants, however, inhibit bacterial activity and mask odors at the same time.
At the same time the parents lay their eggs, the antibody and protein composition of their mucus bulks up.
words.defineEn: simultaneously or at one time
words.defineVi: đồng thời hoặc tại một thời điểm

examples: I recently sold my bike.
The family has grown in size recently.
Recently, Mother Nature threw us a curveball in the form of a 50-degree day in the middle of January.
The gardens have recently been restored to their original glory.
We have clicked well together recently.
words.defineEn: at or during a time that is not long ago
words.defineVi: tại hoặc trong một thời gian không lâu trước đây

examples: She was extremely sick, but we were waiting for a raindrop in the drought.
We were made to feel extremely welcome.
He's extremely irritable - he flies off the handle at the slightest thing.
The Prime Minister is understood to have been extremely angry about the report.
It was a small problem and she has been treated extremely badly.
words.defineEn: to a very great amount or degree
words.defineVi: đến một số lượng rất lớn hoặc mức độ

examples: You nearly gave the game away in the other room.
I nearly fell asleep.
Losing his business nearly broke him.
Tom is nearly always the odd man out.
My mother nearly had kittens when I said I was going to buy a motorbike .
words.defineEn: to a degree that is close to being complete
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ gần như hoàn thành

examples: Mostly, the Chinese government views renewable energy as a major economic opportunity.
And petrochemicals mostly means plastic.
Mostly making war.
The exams mostly tested memorization and recitation from the important government and Confucian texts.
But stone carvings mostly concern gods and wars.
words.defineEn: for the most part; mainly
words.defineVi: hầu hết; chủ yếu

examples: Generally, the article reads very well.
He is generally miserable and never gets on top of his work.
Human nature is generally of such kind that it will choose a line of least resistance if that is at all possible, and loathe exertion beyond it.
You can generally tell when a student is trying to do a snow job.
Generally speaking, the press has given Jacobson a free ride.
words.defineEn: in a way that is true in most cases
words.defineVi: theo cách đó là đúng trong hầu hết các trường hợp

examples: The road led away from the house directly to the lake.
Files can be read and written directly into the file system.
While Anderson did not say directly that changes needed to be made, it was easy to read between the lines.
The quality of our information directly shapes the quality of our decisions.
That structure directly inspired the first convolutional neural networks.
words.defineEn: without changing direction or stopping
words.defineVi: không thay đổi hướng hoặc dừng lại

examples: Hopefully he wasn't cheating with a card up his sleeve.
Hopefully my point came across loud and clear.
Take him for a ride and hopefully by the time you get back, his mother would be here to take him home.
The athlete found joy in the training and the process of improving, rather than just winning the competition, living by the philosophy that it is better to travel hopefully than to arrive.
I told him not to say anything, and he said his lips are sealed, so hopefully he'll be able to keep a secret this time.
words.defineEn: used for expressing that one hopes something will happen
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện rằng một người hy vọng điều gì đó sẽ xảy ra

examples: Consumer finance is not necessarily a money spinner any longer.
That is not necessarily true.
It does not necessarily follow that sleep loss would cause these symptoms.
Expensive restaurants aren’t necessarily the best.
The professor may have a wealth of academic credentials, but a donkey that carries a lot of books is not necessarily learned - true expertise comes from experience and practical application.
words.defineEn: in a way that cannot be avoided
words.defineVi: theo cách không thể tránh được

examples: I will not be more catholic than the Pope, and I shall therefore be voting in favour tomorrow.
Just because you don’t get what you want from people does not mean you should end communication with them and therefore throw out the baby with the bathwater.
Therefore, while they may represent a port in a storm, they are fundamentally unattractive business models.
Therefore, swimming plays a key role in training.
Therefore, that situation no longer has an emotional charge for me.
words.defineEn: said to introduce a statement that is the logical result of the previous one
words.defineVi: được cho là giới thiệu một tuyên bố là kết quả hợp lý của tuyên bố trước đó

examples: Robins build nests almost anywhere.
Are you getting anywhere?
You won’t get anywhere without qualifications.
Being rude to me won't get you anywhere.
Losing your temper won’t get you anywhere.
words.defineEn: to, in, or at any place
words.defineVi: đến, trong, hoặc bất cứ nơi nào

examples: I fully understand the reason for your decision.
They are neither students nor fully qualified practitioners.
My uncle's parting words to me were that life is not separate from death, it only looks that way, and that I should live fully yet let go lightly when the time came to say goodbye.
I don't fully trust John to keep our plan a secret, so I think it best that we keep him in the dark for now.
Though people tried to help, they could never fully grasp the complexities of her circumstances, for only the wearer knows where the shoe pinches and where the most discomfort lies.
words.defineEn: to the largest degree
words.defineVi: ở mức độ lớn nhất

examples: It's actually an incredibly good deal!
He invested wisely and became incredibly rich.
The Bartlett pear I bought from the farmers market was incredibly juicy.
The Persian melon I tried in Iran was incredibly juicy and sweet.
The basketball player is incredibly quick on his feet, able to outmaneuver anyone on the court.
words.defineEn: extremely or to a great degree
words.defineVi: cực kỳ hoặc đến một mức độ tuyệt vời

examples: He has written a song specifically for her.
I specifically told you to be here on time.
The snowshoe hare specifically.
Specifically, these ones called chorus waves.
More specifically, executing his uncle.
words.defineEn: only for one certain type of person or thing
words.defineVi: chỉ dành cho một loại người hoặc vật nhất định

examples: She guessed the answer straight away.
The guard stood straight as a ramrod.
They clicked straight away.
He gives it to you straight.
Sometimes he spoke straight from the shoulder and sometimes in puzzles
words.defineEn: in a manner that is not curved
words.defineVi: theo cách không cong

examples: Unfortunately, experience is the teacher of fools.
Unfortunately, the price of short ribs can be quite high.
Unfortunately, the president struck the wrong note in his speech, ignoring the public mood.
Unfortunately, most companies won't take a long look in the mirror until something goes disastrously wrong.
Unfortunately, I had to give the party a pass because I had a migraine last night.
words.defineEn: used to express regret or say that something is disappointing or sad
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện sự hối tiếc hoặc nói rằng một cái gì đó là thất vọng hoặc buồn

examples: Can two lonely men truly reach out?
Truly, a tree is known by its fruit.
Truly we have beaten swords into ploughshares!
He makes King Lear a truly tragic figure.
Europe has found itself truly at the threshold of a global crisis.
words.defineEn: used for emphasizing a specific feature or quality
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nhấn mạnh một tính năng hoặc chất lượng cụ thể

examples: That said, house prices rose slightly last month.
Emmental's creamy texture and slightly sweet taste make it a crowd-pleaser.
The car manufacturer's latest model outperformed its competitors by a nose, offering slightly better fuel efficiency and a more comfortable ride.
Gouda has a mild and slightly nutty flavor.
He came out of basic training only slightly the worse for wear.
words.defineEn: a little and not very much
words.defineVi: một chút và không nhiều lắm

examples: The days passed slowly.
The day and night passed slowly.
The blades of the helicopter were turning slowly.
The old lady walked slowly with the support of her cane.
He slowly raised his head up.
words.defineEn: moving or doing something at a slow speed; not quickly
words.defineVi: di chuyển hoặc làm điều gì đó với tốc độ chậm; không nhanh chóng

examples: Yet, for the moment anyway, the bankers have lost their Midas touch.
I went to college anyway, as a part-time student, paying my own way.
but i waved a dead chicken and corrected the spelling anyway.
Sarah knew that skipping classes would hurt her grades, but she did it anyway.
I know it's risky, but if I'm going to get in trouble anyway, I might as well be hanged for a sheep as a lamb.
words.defineEn: used when ending a conversation, or changing, or returning to a subject
words.defineVi: được sử dụng khi kết thúc cuộc trò chuyện hoặc thay đổi hoặc quay lại chủ đề

examples: The new smartphone model is currently the flavor of the week among tech enthusiasts.
The whole team is currently working on the project.
The Foreign Secretary is currently having talks with his opposite number in the White House.
They are currently drunk with success.
She is currently making a decision about which university to attend.
words.defineEn: now; at the present time
words.defineVi: Hiện nay; tại thời điểm hiện tại

examples: Suddenly another soldier hits the dirt beside me.
My father died suddenly at the age of 48.
A man suddenly appeared from behind a tree.
Quite suddenly, her mind was made up.
Suddenly things started happening.
words.defineEn: quickly and unexpectedly
words.defineVi: một cách nhanh chóng và bất ngờ
